title: Sampler, 1810–19
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on cotton foundation
Technique: counted and uncounted stitches; cross, herringbone, stem, satin, and couching stitches on plain weave foundation
creditline: Bequest of Rosalie Coe, from the collection inherited from her mother, Eva Johnston Coe
description:
Within a curving, floral border, a top band of buildings and two people skipping rope; a center band of Adam and Eve and with the Tree of Knowledge, birds and plants; and a verse: 
"May virtue guide my inexperienced youth and lead my footsteps to the path of truth" and inscription:
Mary Mankin Aged 14 181_ taught by Mahymer (?) 
The last letter of the date was removed, and 2 was written in ink.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1810–19.
1810–19. Medium: silk embroidery on cotton foundation
Technique: counted and uncounted stitches; cross, herringbone, stem, satin, and couching stitches on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Rosalie Coe, from the collection inherited from her mother, Eva Johnston Coe. 1974-42-19.
